summary: This is a Federal Bureau of Prisons press release announcing the death of inmate Jeffrey Edward Epstein on August 10, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York. Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell from an apparent suicide and was later pronounced dead at a hospital. The FBI is investigating the incident.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: Found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center from an apparent suicide; was a 66-year-old male who arrived at MCC on July 6, 2019, under pretrial status after being indicted for sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy.

events.title: Epstein found unresponsive in cell
events.description: At approximately 6:30 a.m., inmate Jeffrey Edward Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell in the Special Housing Unit at the Metropolitan Correctional Center from an apparent suicide. Life-saving measures were initiated, and he was transported to a local hospital where he was pronounced dead.

events.title: Epstein arrives at MCC New York
events.description: Jeffrey Edward Epstein arrived at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York under pretrial status after being indicted for sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, New York
Local hospital (unspecified) in New York, New York
keyFacts: Jeffrey Edward Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York on August 10, 2019, at approximately 6:30 a.m., from an apparent suicide.
Epstein was transported to a local hospital for treatment but was pronounced dead by hospital staff.
The FBI is investigating the incident.
Epstein arrived at MCC New York on July 6, 2019, under pretrial status after being indicted for sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy.
MCC New York is an Administrative security facility that housed 763 male offenders at the time.
